name: 魏敏樺
objective:
•	This course covers methods slope stability analyses, selection of methods of analysis and strength parameters, field investigation for landslide problems; design strategies; uncertainties in slope analysis and quantitative risk analysis; landslip preventive and protective measures; slope monitoring systems, and various case studies。Emphasis is placed on the selection of material parameters. 
•	坡地工程概論、環境影響評估、坡地工址調查、坡地水土保持技術、邊坡穩定分析、護坡工程設計與分析、坡地監測系統之設置及運用、坡地災害緊急應變處理、坡地災害減災措施、坡地災害案例分析。課程重點於飽和與非飽和土壤力學行為與分析參數之選取。
schedule:
Week 1	: Introduction – Landslides and other instability-related hazards
Week 2 	: Examples and causes of slope failure
Week 3	: Soil mechanics principles
Week 4	: Soil mechanics principles
Week 5 	: Shear strength of soil
Week 6	: Mechanics of Limit Equilibrium Procedures
Week 7   : Mechanics of Limit Equilibrium Procedures
Week 8 	: Mechanics of Limit Equilibrium Procedures
Week 9 	: Midterm Exam Week
Week 10 	: Methods of Analyzing Slope Stability
Week 11 	: Methods of Analyzing Slope Stability
Week 12  : Methods of Analyzing Slope Stability
Week 13 	: Analyses of Embankments with Partial Consolidation
Week 14 	: Slope stabilization methods
Week 15 	: Important Details of Stability Analyses 
Week 16 	: Presenting Results of Stability Evaluations
Week 17 	: Slope Stabilization and Repair
Week 18 	: Final Exam Week
materials:
•Duncan JM and Wright SG (2005). Soil Strength and slope stability. John Wiley & Sons, NY.
•Fredlund DG and Rahardjo H (1993). Soil Mechanics for Unsaturated Soils. John Wiley & Sons, NY.
•Abrasmson LW, Lee TS, Sharma S and Boyce GM (2002). Slope Stability and Stabilization Methods. John Wiley & Sons, Inc.
•Terzaghi and Peck. “Soil Mechanics in Engineering Practice.” John Wiley and Sons.
